data.title: Infor / Lawson Platforms
data.meta_description: Discuss Lawson S3 Sys Admin issues, including platform (Windows, Unix, iSeries) and database (MSSQL, DB2, Oracle, etc.) questions.
data.text:
Removing Custom Tables

Started By This_Guy

Trying to remove Custom tables that are no longer used, but have several custom programs tied to them. I cant simply just DROP TABLE in SQL because of the programs that are using the table references, GEN ties, etc... same with dbdef. Cant do it. Is there an easy way to get rid of those, and all possible residual usage/references to these tables

3 3160

by Kwane McNeal

7/2/2015 5:04 PM

Upgrade TDS from 6.1 to 6.3

Started By Balaji123

HI, We are planning to upgrade our TDS environment from 6.1 to 6.3. OS is Linux. Also parallely we are planning to upgrade DB2 from 9.1 to 10.5. Any one have the step by step doc for this. If so, could you please share it to me. My id will be balajisireeshagmail.com

1 2917

by Kwane McNeal

7/1/2015 8:24 PM

Using bldxffiles to create csv file

Started By tambrosi

Hello, hope somebody can give me some insight---Very new to the Lawson software, and we are working with PR197 and need to create a csv/flat file to be ftp'ed. I tried using the bldxffiles utility and it did the conversion to a csv file, but it only added the LF, I really need to have a CRLF at the end. I looked at the parms for this utility, but it does not seem to have that ability. Is there a better way, when working with the PR197 files Lawson ver 10, Thanks Terry

Automate Clear IOS Cache

Started By Roger French

I need to automate the 'Clear IOS Cache' option within Portal Administration. Has anyone done it before (programatically, as maybe using a call within 4GL, or something else). I just don't have the time to research it right now. I've got a program which redirects some bookmarks to new htmls, and I want to avoid having to manually clear the IOS cache, I want to have it done automatically This is LSF9 on Unix (AIX). Thanks in advance for your help, Roger

Started By Xin Li

I can't figure out how to secure 'Change RM Object' screen in LSA so that they can't remove/add a group, a role, etc. Any help would be appreciated.

GEN in dbdef and laua

Started By Roger French

In 9.0, have noticed GEN is not an option for granting security in laua security class; also it does not appear in dbdef. I haven't been able to find anything which says that GEN should be available, but also I haven't found anything which says it should not be available. Can someone confirm in 9.0 (Unix) that GEN is available or not available when trying to grant access in a Security class Or in dbdef Thank you in advance, -R

We are on 9.0.1.11 environment 9.1.0.5 apps and use LSA security We were told that usergroups in LAUA provided this functionality. I don't understand setting this up in laua when we use LSA but that is what we were told. Started By Chad Dirst

We currently run Lawson 9.0.1.12 environment and am wondering if we can install LSF 10.x over our existing environment or if we should be creating a new environment. Thanks in advance. Chad
